div.l: For whan we maye nought done þan woll we speke
Yette in ower Asschen olde is Fuyer y reke
Fower gledes haue we whiche I schall deuyse
Auauntenge lyenge Ānger Couetyse
These Fower sparkles longeþe vnto elde
Ower olde lymmes maye well be vnwelde
Butte wylle he schall notte Faylen þat is soþe
And yett haue I allwaye a Coltes tothe
As Manye a yere as it is passede henne
Syne þat my toppe of lyfe bigan̄ne to renne
For sikerlye whan I was borne Anone
Deþe droughe the tapp̄e of lyfe ⁊and lette hitt gone
And eủer sythen haþe so the tappe yronne
Tille that allmoste All emptye is the tonne
The streme of lyfe now droppeþe on the chymbe
So the selye tonge maye well rynge ⁊and chymbe
Of wrecchednesse þat passede is Fulle ȝore
With olde Folke saufe dottage þ̉er is no more
Whan þat ower hoste hadde herde this s̉ermonenge
He gan to speken as lordelye as A kynge
He sayde whatt Amounteþe all this wytte
Whatt schall we speke alldaye of holye wrytte
The deuylle made a Reue For to preche
Or of A sowter A schypman or A leche
Saye Forþe thy tale And tarye noughte the tyme
Loo depford And itt is halfe waye pryme
Lo Grynnwycche þat Manye A schrewe is yn
Itt were all tyme thy tale For to bigynne
Now syrres qduod this Oswold the Reue
I praye you All that ye nought ye greue
Though I Answere ⁊and somedele sette his howve
For lefulle hitt is with Force Force of schowve
This drunken Myller haþe ytolde vs here
